intro: Ogcodeia oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ogcodeia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged oppositely along the stem. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Ogcodeia oblongifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
